definition: see 盡人皆知|尽人皆知[jin4 ren2 jie1 zhi1]
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to

sentences.english: The news that even heard Fang lings, represent have been already spread the person all without exception know.
sentences.chinese: 连芳玲都听说了的消息，就代表已经传得人尽皆知了。

sentences.english: It is a widely-known fact that seats on campus are limited.
sentences.chinese: 学校的座位资源有限，这已经是人尽皆知的事实。

sentences.english: Indeed, she has emerged as a cause célèbre in China.
sentences.chinese: 事实上她在中国已经人尽皆知。

sentences.english: The " Rankled Brothers" were already a local legend then.
sentences.chinese: 这对“仇恨兄弟”已经在当地人尽皆知了。

sentences.english: We know security is a myth.
sentences.chinese: 安稳不过是神话，人尽皆知。

definition: known by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
lit. wind and rain sweeping through the town (idiom)/fig. a big scandal/an uproar/the talk of the town
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
lips sealed and not saying anything (idiom); fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
